\chapter{Getting Started}
\label{getting-started:getting-started}\label{getting-started::doc}\label{getting-started:up-is-it-up-yet}

\chapter{Up - A next generation status monitor}
\label{getting-started:up-a-next-generation-status-monitor}
Some times you just need to know, is it up? The goal of this project is to create a easy to use, but highly customizable status monitor.


\section{Setup}
\label{getting-started:setup}
First start by installing the environment.

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\$ mkdir example-status

\$ cd example-status

\$ virtualenv . -p python3 --no-site-packages

\$ bin/pip install up
\end{Verbatim}

Now you need to create the \emph{upfile.py}. It goes in the same folder as everything else. From here you can setup what you want to monitor.

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{up} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{status}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{source}

\PYG{k}{class} \PYG{n+nc}{ExampleStatus}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{status}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{StatusMonitor}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}

    \PYG{n}{source} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{source}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{HTTPStatusSource}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s}{'}\PYG{l+s}{Example Status}\PYG{l+s}{'}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s}{'}\PYG{l+s}{https://example.com/}\PYG{l+s}{'}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{sink} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{sink}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{StdOutStatusSink}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{Verbatim}

You can now run it like this.

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\$ bin/up
Example Status: UP
\end{Verbatim}


\section{Developers Setup}
\label{getting-started:developers-setup}
\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\$ virtualenv . -p python3 --no-site-packages

\$ bin/python setup.py develop
\end{Verbatim}
